content.description: Start with your feet on the holds far under the boulder and hands at hip height. Move up to the loose looking block, then up to big, bomber, horizontal pinch, then top out. This climb is best at mid-low tide or you'll have waves crashing under you while you climb, hence the name.
content.protection: The small, uneven landing doesn't hold a crash pad right, but it's a short climb and it's decently safe.
content.location: Go down the stone stairs, turn left, and make your way across the rocky area to the stone beach. You will see the dark colored "nugget" against the wall in "The Dungeon".

content.description: Walk past ...Take The Ride, and you will see a crack line on the rock next to a dihedral corner. Using this corner is not the line and makes it easier. Follow the crack and the crimps.
content.location: It is 10 feet into the boulder area.

climbs.name: Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride

content.description:
Once you go down the stairs in to the boulder area, walk in a ways. It is hidden to the left. You will see chalk. 

  Start low on two crimps up to an open hand and a large jug side pull, then dyno to a top hold, walk over left to a slope hold, and top out.
content.location: At Castle Rock, go into the boulder area by the ocean. This is behind the big boulder on the shore.

content.description:
Begin with a sit start with two good crimps at about waist height at the left end of the carved out section of the wall with double heel hooks at the right end. The craggy areas to the left and below the face are off after the start.

 The first move is a right throw to a narrow crimp bar above the carved section, followed by a bump up to a better crimp on the weird protrusion from the face. Top out after adjusting your feet and using the slopers at the top of the face. The sit start is crucial to this route, a stand start or using the craggy area ruin the fun. Overall, this is a good warm-up for the other problems in the area.
content.protection: One spotter, but the landing is pretty good.
content.location: It ascends the white, sloping face (hence the name) at the center of the wall you see when facing out to the ocean in the bouldering area.

content.description: Climb up the overhang and up the arete.
content.location: This is the first rock on your left when you get across the rock beach.

content.description: Dungeon has assorted boulders on the beach left of the main Castle Rock area. Some of these boulders can be affected by the tides, so check the tide charts.
